Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs, pursuant to subsections 4(1) to (3) of the Special Economic Measures Acta, makes the annexed Special Economic Measures (Venezuela) Regulations for the purpose of implementing the decision of the Association Concerning the Situation in Venezuela made on September 5, 2017.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Minister means the Minister of Foreign Affairs. (ministre)
Venezuela means the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela and includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any of its political subdivisions;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its government and any of its departments or any government or department of its political subdivisions; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any of its agencies or any agency of its political subdivisions. (Venezuela)

Section.Text: A person whose name is listed in the schedule is a person who is in Venezuela, or is or was a national of Venezuela who does not ordinarily reside in Canada, and in respect of whom the Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds to believe is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has engaged in activities that directly or indirectly undermine the peace, security or stability of Venezuela or the integrity of its democratic institutions;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has engaged in activities that directly or indirectly contribute to or support gross and systematic human rights violations in Venezuela;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: a person who has engaged in activities that directly or indirectly contribute to acts of significant corruption in Venezuela;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a current or former senior official in the Government of Venezuela;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a current or former member of the Constituent National Assembly of Venezuela;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an associate or family member of a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (c);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an entity owned — or held or controlled, directly or indirectly — by a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d); or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a current or former senior official of an entity referred to in paragraph (e).

Section.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: deal in any property, wherever situated, that is owned — or that is held or controlled, directly or indirectly — by a listed person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enter into or facilitate any transaction related to a dealing referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: provide any financial or related services in respect of a dealing referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: make available any goods, wherever situated, to a listed person or to a person acting on behalf of a listed person; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: provide any financial or related services to or for the benefit of a listed person.

Section.Text: Section 3 does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any payment made by or on behalf of a listed person that is due under a contract entered into before the person became a listed person, provided that the payment is not made to a listed person or to a person acting on behalf of a listed person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any transactions necessary for a Canadian to transfer to a non-listed person any accounts, funds or investments of a Canadian held by a listed person on the day on which that person became a listed person;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any dealings with a listed person required with respect to loan repayments made to any person in Canada, or any Canadian outside Canada, for loans entered into with any person other than a listed person, and for enforcement and realization of security in respect of those loans, or payments by guarantors guaranteeing those loans;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any dealings with a listed person required with respect to loan repayments made to any person in Canada, or any Canadian outside Canada, for loans entered into with a listed person before that person became a listed person, and for enforcement and realization of security in respect of those loans, or payments by guarantors guaranteeing those loans;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any benefit paid under the Old Age Security Act, the Canada Pension Plan or an Act respecting the Québec Pension Plan, CQLR, c. R-9, any superannuation, pension or benefit paid under or in respect of any retirement savings plan or under any retirement plan, any amount paid under or in respect of the Garnishment, Attachment and Pension Diversion Act or the Pension Benefits Division Act, and any other payment made in respect of disability to any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: financial services required in order for a listed person to obtain legal services in Canada with respect to the application of any of the prohibitions set out in these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any transaction in respect of any account at a financial institution held by a diplomatic mission, if the transaction is required in order for the mission to fulfill its diplomatic functions as set out in Article 3 of the Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations or, if the diplomatic mission has been temporarily or permanently recalled, when the transaction is required in order to maintain the mission premises;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any transaction with any international organization with diplomatic status, with any United Nations agency, with the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, or with any entity that has entered into a grant or contribution agreement with the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a transaction by the Government of Canada that is provided for in any agreement or arrangement between Canada and Venezuela.

Section.Text: It is prohibited for any person in Canada or any Canadian outside Canada to knowingly do anything that causes, facilitates or assists in, or is intended to cause, facilitate or assist in, any activity prohibited by section 3.

The following entities must determine on a continuing basis whether they are in possession or control of property that is owned — or that is held or controlled, directly or indirectly — by a listed person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: authorized foreign banks, as defined in section 2 of the Bank Act, in respect of their business in Canada, and banks regulated by that Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cooperative credit societies, savings and credit unions and caisses populaires regulated by a provincial Act and associations regulated by the Cooperative Credit Associations Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: foreign companies, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Insurance Companies Act, in respect of their insurance business in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: companies, provincial companies and societies, as those terms are defined in subsection 2(1) of the Insurance Companies Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: fraternal benefit societies regulated by a provincial Act in respect of their insurance activities and insurance companies and other entities regulated by a provincial Act that are engaged in the business of insuring risks;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: companies regulated by the Trust and Loan Companies Act;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: trust companies regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: loan companies regulated by a provincial Act;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: entities that engage in any business described in paragraph 5(h) of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act if the business involves the opening of an account for a client; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: entities authorized under provincial legislation to engage in the business of dealing in securities or to provide portfolio management or investment counselling services.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty to disclose — RCMP or CSIS

Subsection.Text: Every person in Canada, every Canadian outside Canada and every entity set out in section 6 must disclose without delay to the Commissioner of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police or to the Director of the Canadian Security Intelligence Service

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the existence of property in their possession or control that they have reason to believe is owned — or held or controlled, directly or indirectly — by a listed person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any information about a transaction or proposed transaction in respect of property referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: No proceedings under the Special Economic Measures Act and no civil proceedings lie against a person for a disclosure made in good faith under subsection (1).

Section.MarginalNote: Application to no longer be a listed person

Subsection.Text: A listed person may apply to the Minister in writing to have their name removed from the schedule.
On receipt of an application, the Minister must decide whether there are reasonable grounds to recommend to the Governor in Council that the applicant’s name be removed from the schedule.

Section.Text: If there has been a material change in circumstances since the last application was submitted, a person may submit another application under section 8.

Subsection.Text: A person whose name is the same as or similar to the name of a listed person and who claims not to be that person may apply to the Minister in writing for a certificate stating that they are not that listed person.
Within 30 days after receiving the application, the Minister must,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it is established that the applicant is not the listed person, issue the certificate; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is not so established, provide notice to the applicant of his or her determination.

Section.Text: For the purpose of paragraph 11(2)(a) of the Statutory Instruments Act, these Regulations apply according to their terms before they are published in the Canada Gazette.
These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Item.Text: Caryslia Beatriz RODRIGUEZ RODRIGUEZ (born on July 16, 1967)
Juan Carlos HIDALGO PANDARES (born on October 20, 1961)
